thread.title: Comment on Washington Post columnist rips Pitino a new one by Bill
thread.title_full: Comment on Washington Post columnist rips Pitino a new one by Bill

author: Bill
title: Comment on Washington Post columnist rips Pitino a new one by Bill
text:
Article written by Mrs. Tyler Thompson No, I will not make you a sandwich, but you can follow me on Twitter @MrsTylerKSR or email me . 47 responses to ‚ÄúWashington Post columnist rips Pitino a new one‚Äù John Ellis October 21, 2015 at 2:47   
I don‚Äôt mean to question her veracity, but I believe it was actually on the booth cushion, all fifteen seconds of it. John Ellis October 21, 2015 at 2:48 pm | Permalink 
Any settlement with Pitino should include requiring him to remove the Louisville tattoo. UofLOL October 21, 2015 at 3:53 pm | Permalink 
How much funnier would that ‚ÄúNational champion‚Äù tattoo be when they vacate the title haha UKChillfan October 21, 2015 at 3:05   
About as good as it gets, enjoyed the read. catdaddyd October 21, 2015 at 10:13 pm | Permalink 
Damn Catlin Jenner is everywhere. Dude October 21, 2015 at 3:07   
Did she confuse Richard for Rick‚Äôs nephew? Dude October 21, 2015 at 3:09   
OK, nevermind. October 21, 2015 at 3:11   
BOOM! Very nice! L1*C7 laughing stock of college basketball. Joe Kyle October 21, 2015 at 3:11   
She‚Äôs convinced me of one thing, Tom Jurich didn‚Äôt know this was going on, if he did no way he would re-up Rick‚Äôs long term high dollar contract for as long and as much as he did. UKBlue1! October 21, 2015 at 3:51 pm | Permalink 
Ole Tommy Turtleneck thought they would never get caught. I think they all knew. This is one of the dirtiest programs in all of college sports. Catlogic 15 October 21, 2015 at 3:21   
Great satirical view. Makes hilarious the absurdness of ‚Äúnobody knew or saw a thing‚Äù. Fayette County October 21, 2015 at 3:23   
Many colleges have scandals. I‚Äôm sure at some point something was taken to Pitino. But, laughing stock? No, just joke of the day. Uk, Syracuse, and many others have been there. Times moves fast. This, too, shall pass. We need little brother to be strong to lift our state with us so we propser. In otherwords, laugh now but quit sucking this b*tches tit you douche. CatsBy80 October 21, 2015 at 3:36 pm | Permalink 
T-Will, is that you? ClutchCargo October 21, 2015 at 3:42 pm | Permalink 
Not only is he in denial about the severity of this, he is even trying to pretend he isn‚Äôt a U of L fan. FayetteTheTroll October 21, 2015 at 3:38   
nice try, but I‚Äôll keep suckin this tit as long as it keeps tasting sweet. You go suckin on what ever you lke. ClutchCargo October 21, 2015 at 3:48 pm | Permalink 
Her face looks like she just walked in on Katina Powell taking it up the pooper from Montrezl, but yes by all means keep sucking that tit because it is indeed sweet! AlinIndy October 21, 2015 at 5:01 pm | Permalink 
Just last Monday a guy was still giving me hell for the loss to Wisconsin, as I told him I was over it and you uvel folks should be more worried about your future as your worried about our past. He then told me that‚Äôs going nowhere, they‚Äôve all forgotten what that was all about‚Ä¶.That was before the ‚ÄúDutchess of the Dorm‚Äù made her TV debut Tuesday‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.He‚Äôs missing in action as I type‚Ä¶..I‚Äôve called, texted‚Ä¶.Just like he‚Äôs disappeared off the face of the earth‚Ä¶.. BDP October 21, 2015 at 3:42   
So can the Tards 2016 recruits get out of there commitments? I would not want to go there. Don‚Äôt they have one five star commit? Surely he doesn‚Äôt want to enter that mess. We already dominate this team, it is really going to get bad if they can‚Äôt recruit (bad PR, unable to use hookers, ect) inside info2 October 21, 2015 at 3:55 pm | Permalink 
If I knew the staff was going to give me money to get laid I wouldn‚Äôt want to leave! CatsBy80 October 21, 2015 at 3:59 pm | Permalink 
i read on ESPN yesterday that some kid committed to UofL yesterday, despite all of this swarming around their program‚Ä¶ not sure i understand the logic of his choice. inside info2 October 21, 2015 at 3:54   
Any other coach in America would have already resigned over this. I really can‚Äôt believe The President or Chancellor hasn‚Äôt forced Jurich to force Pitino to resign. Yesterday and the day before the scuttlebutt in the Athletic Department was that Pitino was gone. Today somebody said that Jurich is defending Pitino even harder behind the scenes. Absolutely crazy. Jurich should be fired too. Catlogic15 October 21, 2015 at 4:42 pm | Permalink 
Jurich wants Pitino there as long as he can. He wants to wait to serve him up when the NCAA gets serious. Jurich doesn‚Äôt want to be hanging out there all by himself right now. KT October 21, 2015 at 5:42 pm | Permalink 
^^Catlogic nailed it. I hadn‚Äôt thought of it from that angle. He‚Äôs unscrupulous enough to do it too, even to his loyal coach who is lying for him right now. Hey Rick, check out that bus‚Ä¶shove. Bowhunter4bucks October 21, 2015 at 4:25   
The real question is‚Ä¶.did he know or did he not know. That‚Äôs going to be difficult to prove either way. KT October 21, 2015 at 5:39 pm | Permalink 
No, it doesn‚Äôt matter. He‚Äôs in charge, it‚Äôs his program, you make the big bucks, you get the big responsibilities. Simple as that. Personally, I think Jurich should also face scrutiny but he will slither quietly away I‚Äôm sure and let others take the fall, he‚Äôs good at that. 
‚Ä¶and honestly, Pitino coached here too, does anybody actually believe he didn‚Äôt know about this? Dude is a tyrant and knows every aspect of everyone‚Äôs business or at least he did at UK. Unless that changed I call BS on him. With the crap they‚Äôve had going on for years even Louis Braille would have seen something. Randy Marsh October 21, 2015 at 4:54   
Sorry officers I haven‚Äôt seen any space cash here. France, Italy, Mexico, you guys seen any space cash? No? Alright. Yea, officers, doesn‚Äôt look like anyone in the world saw any space cash. KT October 21, 2015 at 5:32   
Damn Sally. Mic dropped. Tom October 21, 2015 at 5:44   
As long as Saint Cal isn‚Äôt concerned about national championships, telling his players to play for the names on the back of their jerseys, kept the Harrison twins in the game late against Wisconsin out of loyality instead of putting the best he had on the floor, why worry about what happens in Louisville? Come on, Kentucky fans really are concerned about winning the big dance are they? CATandMONKEY October 21, 2015 at 5:58 pm | Permalink 
This is only the biggest story in sports, nationally. Perhaps we should ignore this 4-alarm dumpster fire in the Commonwealth ‚Äòs largest city‚Ä¶because it certainly is being ignored by the media across the entire country. TroLLoL October 21, 2015 at 9:43 pm | Permalink 
I always knew Tom was a pro-Louisville troll. üòâ Gill Tee October 21, 2015 at 5:58   
What a weak, deceitful, little Napoleon. wooddoug October 21, 2015 at 6:00   
This comment was made in the original article‚Ä¶It is unfortunate that I read this before seeing it was written by Ms. Jenkins. After her hagiographic defense of Lance Armstrong without expressly acknowledging that she ghost wrote a book for Mr. Armstrong, I agreed with Mr. Walsh of the Sunday Times that Ms. Jenkins had forfeited her right to continue as a journalist and should disappear. So I promised myself I would never read anything she wrote again. I need to pay closer attention to the byline. Perhaps articles written by Ms. Jenkins should come with a warning . NoelGallagher October 21, 2015 at 6:18   
She wrote that best selling Lance Armstrong Fiction, hard to put much weight in her opinion. jmlville October 21, 2015 at 6:54   
I hope that none of you are in a situation where you are accused of something and are being judged by other human beings on a national platform like social media. There is a lot of components involved here that no one knows about but, apparently, most of you and the writer of this glorious (sarcastic) article know more than the NCAA at this time to the point where you are confident in your stance and opinions. Pitino is a coach but, he is also a father, a patriarch in his family, a mentor and more, How about respecting those that are his ‚Äòfamily‚Äô and stop the noise. If any one of you can look in the mirror and truly state that you have not done something in your life that you regret and shouldn‚Äôt have done then by all means, continue to post judgement and blame. He made a mistake in the past, but, who hasn‚Äôt? B/c of his highly public role, his mistake provoked national media attention. I believe everyone makes mistakes and everyone deserves forgiveness and second chances. He has kept a clean slate and if it comes out that mcgee was the one and only UL staff member that took part and created this mess, you all might feel pretty bad (at least I hope ‚Äì b/c otherwise you aren‚Äôt human) to smear pitino‚Äôs name. You all are contributing to what is wrong with our society ‚Äì there is no focus on positive, good feeling stories but, negative media and judgement and ridicule; congrats, most of you are now part of that. I wish you all peace and have some faith in our system to get to the truth and be the ones to judge in a legal manner. I am supporting pitino. Stormin' October 21, 2015 at 7:06 pm | Permalink 
Assume you were not one of the Card fans who continue to bring up Coach Cal and NCAA actions at his previous schools. Assume you are not one of those fans who continue to make comments about when UK will have its title taken away by NCAA because UK has all of those evil ones and dones, and, well, you are sure you know how evil the UK coach is. You‚Äôre not THAT guy, right? 
Glass house, meet rock. Ha! October 21, 2015 at 9:45 pm | Permalink 
Too bad. Your program f*cked up. Everything you get, you deserve. Karma is a bitch, huh? üòâ 
#L1CWHORE Hey October 21, 2015 at 10:21 pm | Permalink 
If this was reversed, Cal would be KILLED in the media and especially by Louisville fans. Absolutely slaughtered. So just save it. Stormin' October 21, 2015 at 6:58   
The story just ran on ABC evening news. Was treated as a major piece. Hits just keep on comin‚Äô for Rick and the birdies. leon singleton October 21, 2015 at 7:16   
Washington is home to sleeze bags. What Louisville done would be normall there. Ha! October 21, 2015 at 9:46 pm | Permalink 
I knew you were a Louisville troll. 
#L1CWHORE October 21, 2015 at 10:04 pm | Permalink 
‚Äú‚Ä¶..sleeze bags. What Louisville done would be normall there.‚Äù 
Beautifully written. Well done, sir. Capitalcatfan October 21, 2015 at 7:23   
Geez, jlmville‚Ä¶Looks like I wasted 90 seconds of my life that I can‚Äôt get back. Let‚Äôs see‚Ä¶patriarch, father, mentor, uh, what am I missing? Oh yeah, head coach of a major college basketball program supposedly forming the habits and work ethic of young men in his charge. Look in the mirror? Of course I can, but then I‚Äôm not being paid nearly 5 mil a year to do so. Support him if you choose to do so, but I have a feeling you‚Äôll be doing so while he‚Äôs looking for another job. October 21, 2015 at 8:01   
Your obsession with RP continues. Shameless piling on. Ha! October 21, 2015 at 9:47 pm | Permalink 
Ha!
